SALES TIPS FOR INDEPENDENT PROFESSIONALS Independent workers bear additional responsibility; they not only must perform their work, but find the work as well. Winning new contracts takes more than luck and a good body of work. It requires having a consistent plan of action to keep leads flowing into your project pipeline. It requires a commitment to add “working on” your business as a fixed item on your weekly agenda.
Putting off business development is not an option for the solo worker. Inconsistent business development can subject you to an inconsistent revenue stream. To avoid the dreaded feast or famine cycle, independents must learn to become “rainmakers.” Relying solely on one or two large contracts may work in the present, but your future success is dependent on how you acquire new business.
